field.name: description
field.value:
The idea is to be able to combine and allow browsers to cache a set of files:
#blockcomponent(JSCombine) $combiner.add("$siteroot/content/jquery-1.2.3.js") $combiner.add("$siteroot/content/jquery-someplug.js") $combiner.add("$siteroot/content/myjs.js") #end
Which should output something like
<script type="text/javascript" src="/monorail/files/somekey?SOMEHASHCODE"></script>
The hascode should be a composition of the lastmodified of each file's lastmodified attribute, so if a file is changed, the browser will request them again.
There should also be a CssCombine

comment.author: ewhauser
comment.text:
Here is a patch based off of the original code on your blog. It will combine both CSS and Javascript output. Alex Henderson also contributed some code for this patch.
We need to wait for the YUI Compressor .NET (http://www.codeplex.com/YUICompressor) to release a signed version of their library before it can be included as a dependency in Monorail. I've requested that they do so, and will update this issue when this happens. In the meantime, this patch should be usuable by anyone who wants to download the dependency and try the component out.
